body:
Hey guys,

So let me tell you a story... Today my friend was in Geography with a teacher called let's say Mr Scott. Mr Scott saw my friend reading a book while he was teaching, so he said: "Have you ever seen a book fly?" as he picked the book up and threw it from the second story of the building into the pouring rain. It is now unreadable and VERY damaged.

What is wrong with people? That is abuse and a very rude thing to do. -_- Some people; wow! I honestly find that so inappropriate and rude of a teacher. How disrespectful..

Talking of some people I made a post yesterday, claiming that it was my only copy of a test I wrote for myself and that it was editable. I then told everyone how great our community was because no one ruined it. Some immature idiot then came onto it and put up a lot of bad things -_- 

A staff member then decided it would be a great idea to super archive it? Instead of just removing the link to my document. I asked Shiro if he could view it, nope.

If you see a topic that is inappropriate, remove anything inappropriate please. Don't archive it and oppress freedom of information.

Anyway that's my rant! xD 

Regards,


The Tortoise :o

replies.body:
LOL. What an interesting story. I get where your going some people can just blown your mind with the retarded things they do.

I was go-carting in NZ a long time ago when I was young, when this guy behind was accelerating so fast. He purposely pushed me into the bushes. My back was sorta damaged and I had scars/scratches over my face from the branches in the bushes.

Needless to say I had to go back into the go-cart and go all the way down the mountain. To make it back to where my family was. We immediately went back to the hotel and I had to get a check up.

Trust me I was like "WOW! Why The Fack would you do that to me". I was like only 7 Years old. Now I'm 16. That stuff is ingrained into my mind.
